content:
• Monday, August 15, 2011
  • NLST

    Microcap memory component maker Netlist (OTC:NLST) is soaring in after hours trading following a...

    Microcap memory component maker Netlist (OTC:NLST) is soaring in after hours trading following a Q2 report that easily topped estimates on a 197% jump in flash drive shipments. Shares +21% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:16 PM | 2 Comments
  • BAC

    Financial stocks recouped some of their early-August losses today. Bank of America (BAC +7.9%)...

    Financial stocks recouped some of their early-August losses today. Bank of America (BAC +7.9%) headlined the winners, thanks to its credit card business sale and positive news regarding its Countrywide lawsuits, but other big names also got a lift. MS +6.1%. AIG +6%. C +4.8%. WFC +3.7%. STI +5.9%. USB +3.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • DG

    Dollar General (NYSE:DG) is up 3.8% AH, and Verisk Analytics (NASDAQ:VRSK) up 4.6%, after...

    Dollar General (NYSE:DG) is up 3.8% AH, and Verisk Analytics (NASDAQ:VRSK) up 4.6%, after Berkshire Hathaway's (BRK.A, BRK.B) latest 13-F filing reveals Warren Buffett's company to have acquired stakes in the firms. Berkshire has also increased its stakes in Wells Fargo (NYSE:WFC) and Mastercard (NYSE:MA), while slightly reducing its position in Kraft (KFT).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM
  • MRK

    Merck (MRK +2.5%) CEO Kenneth Frazier bought $1M worth of the company’s shares today,...

    Merck (MRK +2.5%) CEO Kenneth Frazier bought $1M worth of the company’s shares today, InsiderScore.com reports, just days after CFO Peter Kellogg bought ~$500,000 worth of shares, a rare series of buys at the drugmaker. In fact, until the recent purchases, no one at the company had bought shares in more than two years.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:32 PM | 2 Comments
  • ESLRQ

    Evergreen Solar (ESLR -57.6%) has finally bitten the dust. The solar panel maker, whose shares...

    Evergreen Solar (ESLR -57.6%) has finally bitten the dust. The solar panel maker, whose shares reached lofty heights prior to the financial crisis on optimism regarding its String Ribbon wafer technology, has filed for Chapter 11, as strong Chinese competition and slumping European demand prove too much to cope with. (PR) (previously)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 13 Comments
  • NCR

    NCR closed +4.3% higher today after landing a contract - its largest ever in China - to provide...

    NCR closed +4.3% higher today after landing a contract - its largest ever in China - to provide hardware-maintenance services for about 10,000 automated-teller machines installed in China's Agricultural Bank (OTCPK:ACGBY).
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • A

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ3 EPS of $0.77 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.69B (+22% Y/Y)...

    Agilent Technologies (NYSE:A): FQ3 EPS of $0.77 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $1.69B (+22% Y/Y) in-line. Order of $1.69B (+13% Y/Y). Expects Q4FY11 revenue at $1.74B-$1.79B, Non-GAAP EPS at $0.79-$0.81. Expects FY11 revenue at $6.64B-$6.66B, Non-GAAP EPS at $2.90-$2.92. Shares -1.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:10 PM | 1 Comment
  • ZQK

    Quiksilver (ZQK +4%) closes the day up solidly after FBR upgraded the stock earlier on...

    Quiksilver (ZQK +4%) closes the day up solidly after FBR upgraded the stock earlier on valuation. The firm cites postives from debt-reduction efforts and increased orders, despite risk from cost inflation and a challenged top line.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:09 PM
  • URBN

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q2 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $609M (+10% Y/Y)...

    Urban Outfitters (NASDAQ:URBN): Q2 EPS of $0.35 beats by $0.03. Revenue of $609M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $5M. 20 new stores opened in 1HFY11. Shares +7.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM
  • PPDI

    Drug R&D outsourcing firm Pharmaceutical Product Development (NASDAQ:PPDI) closes up 18.5%...

    Drug R&D outsourcing firm Pharmaceutical Product Development (NASDAQ:PPDI) closes up 18.5% following a Bloomberg report claiming Carlyle is in talks to buy the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • UTSI

    Chinese network solutions provider UTStarcom (UTSI +19.1%) holds on to gains into the close...

    Chinese network solutions provider UTStarcom (UTSI +19.1%) holds on to gains into the close after announcing a $20M share buyback earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:00 PM
  • MCD

    Shares of McDonald's (MCD +0.1%) - along with fellow blue-chippers Coca-Cola (KO +1.7%) and...

    Shares of McDonald's (MCD +0.1%) - along with fellow blue-chippers Coca-Cola (KO +1.7%) and Procter & Gamble (PG +1.1%) - are easily outperforming market indices in August as investor's shift their appetite towards established companies offering attractive payouts. Current dividend yields: KO 2.8%, MCD 2.8%, PG 3.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM | 1 Comment
  • SUN

    Sunoco (SUN +7%) holds on to gains late in the day after Macquarie ups the stock to outperform,...

    Sunoco (SUN +7%) holds on to gains late in the day after Macquarie ups the stock to outperform, saying the company's refineries are running at full capacity and should result in stronger margins and better-than-anticipated results in Q3.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:52 PM
  • KND

    Kindred Healthcare (KND +4.1%) jumps after a mention in a Barron's article over the weekend says...

    Kindred Healthcare (KND +4.1%) jumps after a mention in a Barron's article over the weekend says the company's prospects are much healthier than the market thinks. The stock was hit hard earlier this month when Medicare announced an 11.1% cut in reimbursement rates for nursing homes.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:46 PM
  • HES

    As NYMEX crude rallies to nearly $88/barrel, oil stocks are also rebounding from the mayhem of...

    As NYMEX crude rallies to nearly $88/barrel, oil stocks are also rebounding from the mayhem of early August. Some top-performing large-caps: HES +5.3%. OXY +4.9%. STO +4%. BHI +4.6%. NOV +4.9%. HAL +4.3%. MRO +3.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:44 PM
  • HOTT

    Specialty retailer Hot Topic (HOTT +3.8%) ticks higher late in the day after Piper Jaffray ups...

    Specialty retailer Hot Topic (HOTT +3.8%) ticks higher late in the day after Piper Jaffray ups the stock to neutral. Piper cites improving top-line trends in its Torrid division and a solid H2 licensing pipeline with the upcoming release of a new Twilight movie.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM
  • HOV

    Though the NAHB Housing Market Index was merely in-line with expectations, homebuilders are...

    Though the NAHB Housing Market Index was merely in-line with expectations, homebuilders are outperforming the market today, with highly beaten-down names such as Hovnanian (HOV +13.3%) and Beazer Homes (BZH +15.8%) performing especially well. DHI +3.8%. LEN +5.1%. TOL +3.5%. PHM +5.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:31 PM
  • GM

    General Motors (GM +2.9%) receives a lift from Ticonderoga with a Buy rating, as the firm sees...

    General Motors (GM +2.9%) receives a lift from Ticonderoga with a Buy rating, as the firm sees more cost-cutting potential from the automaker. Shares have now fully retraced last week's decline and still trade with a single-digit P/E ratio.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • CARB

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) is up another 15% today - shares are now nearly 50% above Thursday's IPO...

    Carbonite (NASDAQ:CARB) is up another 15% today - shares are now nearly 50% above Thursday's IPO price of $10. The company, which currently sports a market cap of $358M, could be getting a lift from a report cloud storage kingpin Dropbox is raising money at a $5B+ valuation.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM | 1 Comment
  • DNDN

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN +20.3%) recover nicely on volume 2X normal after a recent 70% loss in...

    Shares of Dendreon (DNDN +20.3%) recover nicely on volume 2X normal after a recent 70% loss in share value - related to the firm's devastating result with its Provenge cancer treatment - looks overdone to investors.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM
  • SORL

    Chinese parts supplier SORL Auto Parts (SORL -6.7%) drops after missing Q2 estimates and cutting...

    Chinese parts supplier SORL Auto Parts (SORL -6.7%) drops after missing Q2 estimates and cutting its FY11 forecast. Revenue was down 12% on higher raw-material costs and slower domestic commercial vehicle sales.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • XOM

    Oil prices (USO +2.8%) are up smartly with cautious optimism on the outlook for Eurozone...

    Oil prices (USO +2.8%) are up smartly with cautious optimism on the outlook for Eurozone economies and Japan's GDP beat. Big Oil: XOM +3%, CVX +2.8%, BP +3.2%, PBR +3.6%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:30 PM
  • RSG

    Republic Services (RSG +4%) holds on to gains after announcing a $750M share repurchase earlier...

    Republic Services (RSG +4%) holds on to gains after announcing a $750M share repurchase earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • DIN

    DineEquity (DIN +5.3%) holds on to gains after announcing a $45M buyback earlier today.

    DineEquity (DIN +5.3%) holds on to gains after announcing a $45M buyback earlier today.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • WSM

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM -3.1%) falls after Barclays moves bearish on hardline retailers and hits...

    Williams-Sonoma (WSM -3.1%) falls after Barclays moves bearish on hardline retailers and hits the firm with a downgrade from Overweight to Equal Weight. The firm slashed its price target on WSM to $35 from $45.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:42 PM
  • CBOU

    Caribou Coffee (CBOU -6.2%) dips after the company announces Caribou Holding - a major...

    Caribou Coffee (CBOU -6.2%) dips after the company announces Caribou Holding - a major stockholder - plans to sell its remaining 28% stake in the coffee maker in a 5.15M share secondary offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:41 PM
  • EXAS

    Exact Sciences (EXAS +12.4%), pops on a valuation upgrade from Rodman & Renshaw. The firm...

    Exact Sciences (EXAS +12.4%), pops on a valuation upgrade from Rodman & Renshaw. The firm says the stock has been one of the best performers in the biotech sector over the last two years, and took a "disproportionate beating" during the recent selloff.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:12 PM
  • CXDC

    China XD Plastics (CXDC +40%) is soaring today after posting a solid FQ2, and announcing that...

    China XD Plastics (CXDC +40%) is soaring today after posting a solid FQ2, and announcing that Morgan Stanley Private Equity Asia has agreed to invest $100M in the company for a significant minority ownership stake.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM | 1 Comment
  • ASTI

    Microcap Ascent Solar Technologies (OTC:ASTI +64%) soars after announcing a $450M strategic...

    Microcap Ascent Solar Technologies (OTC:ASTI +64%) soars after announcing a $450M strategic partnership with TFG Radiant Group that includes investments by TFG in Ascent and the development of manufacturing facilities in East Asia.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:38 PM
  • CATY

    Cathay General Bancorp (CATY +9%) jumps this morning after RBC upgrades the stock to outperform...

    Cathay General Bancorp (CATY +9%) jumps this morning after RBC upgrades the stock to outperform on valuation, citing improved profitability, expanding margins and the bank's progress in resolving credit issues.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:15 PM
  • SYY

    Shares of SYSCO (SYY -5.2%) sink after the firm reports in-line FQ4 EPS, but sees gross margins...

    Shares of SYSCO (SYY -5.2%) sink after the firm reports in-line FQ4 EPS, but sees gross margins fall to 18.6%, from 19.2%, as pressure from food-cost inflation starts to build up. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:09 PM
  • MOBI

    Defying the realities of a negative Q1 earnings preannouncement on Friday and a downgrade by...

    Defying the realities of a negative Q1 earnings preannouncement on Friday and a downgrade by Oppenheimer today, shares of Chinese mobile app-maker Sky-mobi (MOBI +9.3%) trade higher again this morning. After an initial sell off on Friday, the stock has soared nearly 70% without any apparent catalyst.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • SEMG

    Midstream oil services provider SemGroup (NYSE:SEMG) is up 11% after reporting Q2 revenue of...

    Midstream oil services provider SemGroup (NYSE:SEMG) is up 11% after reporting Q2 revenue of $344.2M (+9% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.30. The company is reaffirming 2011 adjusted EBITDA guidance of $120M-$140M, and expects the IPO of its Rose Rock Midstream subsidiary to occur "not any earlier" than Q4. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 11:54 AM
  • GDOT

    Green Dot (GDOT +5.7%) moves higher after Goldman Sachs upgrades the firm to Buy from Neutral,...

    Green Dot (GDOT +5.7%) moves higher after Goldman Sachs upgrades the firm to Buy from Neutral, saying regulatory and competitive concerns are already baked into the current share price.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • OMX

    Shares of Officemax (OMX +11.8%) pop after Zacks ups it to neutral. The firm cites improvements...

    Shares of Officemax (OMX +11.8%) pop after Zacks ups it to neutral. The firm cites improvements in customer service, cost cutting measures and inventory shifts that should lead to margin gains in coming quarters. Additionally, SEC filings show CEO Saligram Krishnamurty purchased around 38K shares last Friday.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:57 AM
  • VMW

    VMware (VMW +4%) shares surge after analysts at both Credit Suisse and Collins Stewart raise...

    VMware (VMW +4%) shares surge after analysts at both Credit Suisse and Collins Stewart raise their ratings on the virtualization software provider, seeing advantages in the recent shift in its software licensing model. “Longer-term the changes are exactly what is needed to ensure future revenue streams that reflect actual customer usage of VMware,” Stewart says.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • CYBX

    Cyberonics (CYBX -5.7%) is down this morning after halting shipment and initiating a voluntary...

    Cyberonics (CYBX -5.7%) is down this morning after halting shipment and initiating a voluntary recall of its Aspire platform generators due to output current irregularities. The generators - used in the treatment of refractory epilepsy - represent around 9% of the company's current revenue mix.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:33 AM
  • SHW

    Valspar (VAL +2.2%) trades higher after reporting Q3 EPS and revenue in-line and reaffirming...

    Valspar (VAL +2.2%) trades higher after reporting Q3 EPS and revenue in-line and reaffirming guidance on FY11 EPS at $2.47-$2.57. The firm's CEO says, "double-digit top-line growth resulting from acquisitions, pricing and market share gains," offset higher costs and a tough environment for demand. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:05 AM
  • JBLU

    Airline stocks (FAA +2.4%) outpace the broad market as investors take a second look at a sector...

    Airline stocks (FAA +2.4%) outpace the broad market as investors take a second look at a sector sharply sold off in the last two weeks. Helane Becker of Dahlman Rose upgrades the group on low valuation, after holdings sells and neutrals on carriers for most of the year. Gainers: JBLU +4.4%, TAM +3.8%, UAL +3.1%, LCC +3.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:54 AM
  • LOW

    A JPMorgan analyst says if Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) weak report drags down Home Depot (NYSE:HD) today,...

    A JPMorgan analyst says if Lowe's (NYSE:LOW) weak report drags down Home Depot (NYSE:HD) today, investor should look to buy shares ahead of HD's earnings report tomorrow. The firm sees the home improvement giant reporting stronger numbers than peers. Premarket: LOW -2.4%, HD -0.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM
  • ZAGG

    Shares of Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) soar 10.3% premarket after the firm beats Q2 EPS by $0.07,...

    Shares of Zagg (NASDAQ:ZAGG) soar 10.3% premarket after the firm beats Q2 EPS by $0.07, reporting $0.19 vs. $0.12 consensus. The firm raises guidance for FY11 revenue to $160M-$170M, from $105M-$110M, on a sharply improved sales outlook. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:06 AM
  • AMRX

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL) and GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) announce positive top-line results of a...

    Impax Laboratories (IPXL) and GlaxoSmithKline (NYSE:GSK) announce positive top-line results of a Parkinson's disease study, as the firms move forward with their applications to the FDA and European Union. Premarket: IPXL +8.9%, GSK +0.8%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • GOOG

    Premarket gainers: MMI +58%. ZAGG +11%. NOK +9%. RAH +8%. YOKU +8%. RIMM +6%. ALU +4%. S +4%. DB...

    Premarket gainers: MMI +58%. ZAGG +11%. NOK +9%. RAH +8%. YOKU +8%. RIMM +6%. ALU +4%. S +4%. DB +4%. UAL +3%. RENN +3%. HIG +3%. MCP +3%. LVLT +3%. HBAN +3%. BAC +3%.
    Losers: IDCC -19%. GOOG -3%. LOW -3%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:00 AM
  • EL

    Shares of Estee Lauder (NYSE:EL) fall 6.1% premarket after the firm beats estimates, but...

    Shares of Estee Lauder (NYSE:EL) fall 6.1% premarket after the firm beats estimates, but disappoints investors with its outlook. The firm sees net sales increasing 11%-13% for Q1 FY12, and 6%-8% for full-year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • EL

    More on (NYSE:EL) Q4 earnings: Sees 1Q12 EPS of $1.10-1.20 compared to consensus of $1.12; FY12...

    More on (NYSE:EL) Q4 earnings: Sees 1Q12 EPS of $1.10-1.20 compared to consensus of $1.12; FY12 adj. EPS of $4.00-4.20 below the consensus of $4.37. Shares -6.3% premarket. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:47 AM
  • GOOG

    More on Google/MMI: As Adam Muller noted last month, Motorola has $5.5B in cash and deferred tax...

    More on Google/MMI: As Adam Muller noted last month, Motorola has $5.5B in cash and deferred tax assets; this could put Google's (NASDAQ:GOOG) real purchase price around $7B. Jay Yarow speculates Motorola's set-top business could strengthen Google TV; however, the software for these boxes is typically controlled by service providers, who have been wary of Google TV.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:40 AM
  • YZC

    Shares of Yanzhou Coal (NYSE:YZC) jump 3.8% higher premarket as coal producers look set to...

    Shares of Yanzhou Coal (NYSE:YZC) jump 3.8% higher premarket as coal producers look set to benefit from increased demand for power in China. Other coal stocks (NYSEARCA:KOL) pointing towards a solid opening: WLT +1.4%, BTU +1.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:15 AM
  • IDCC

    Quick take on Google/Motorola: Expect Google to start shopping Motorola's phone and set-top box...

    Quick take on Google/Motorola: Expect Google to start shopping Motorola's phone and set-top box businesses; it likely has little interest in making cable boxes or directly competing with its Android hardware partners. Motorola's patents and R&D talent are the company's main focus. InterDigital (NASDAQ:IDCC), rumored to be in buyout talks with Google and others, is down 19.4% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • SYY

    SYSCO (NYSE:SYY): FQ4 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $10.4B (+0.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares...

    SYSCO (NYSE:SYY): FQ4 EPS of $0.57 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $10.4B (+0.8% Y/Y) in-line. Shares +2.5% premarket. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 8:07 AM
  • BAC

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) is exiting the international credit card business, selling its $8.6B...

    Bank of America (NYSE:BAC) is exiting the international credit card business, selling its $8.6B Canadian portfolio to TD Bank (NYSE:TD) and planning sales of its U.K. and Irish holdings. A cynic might attribute the move to a troubled lender unloading assets on the cheap to raise liquidity. Nevertheless, shares +3.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:01 AM | 3 Comments
  • GOOG

    More on Google/MMI: The deal "will enable Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) to supercharge the Android...

    More on Google/MMI: The deal "will enable Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) to supercharge the Android ecosystem and will enhance competition in mobile computing. Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI) will remain a licensee of Android and Android will remain open. Google will run Motorola Mobility as a separate business." (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:54 AM
  • BB

    Research in Motion (RIMM +6%) and Nokia (NOK +5%) shares leap on the GOOG/MMI deal. Will they be...

    Research in Motion (RIMM +6%) and Nokia (NOK +5%) shares leap on the GOOG/MMI deal. Will they be next?
     
     
     
     
    | 7:51 AM
  • GOOG

    More on Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) buying Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI): Google will pay $40 a share in...

    More on Google (NASDAQ:GOOG) buying Motorola Mobility (NYSE:MMI): Google will pay $40 a share in cash, a premium of 63% to MMI's closing price of $24.47 on Friday. MMI +60%, GOOG -2.9%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 7:50 AM
